issue.body: Not ready to be merged, but I wanted to start the review process. I've been working mainly in parallel with [`ardite-rest`](https://github.com/ardite/ardite-rest) adding stuff when/where it makes sense.

issue.title: Feat/memory
issue.body:
The beginnings of the `Memory` driver implementation. This PR is not ready to be merged, but ready for review to start. It moves some generic test code into [`ardite-driver-tests`](https://github.com/ardite/ardite-driver-tests) (may be renamed to `ardite-driver-spec` or `ardite-driver-specification`). This decision to move test code should also be reviewed.

Note that this branch will be merged into `feat/service`, not `develop`, when ready.

issue.title: Making ardite-core a monorepo
issue.body: What do you think about making `ardite-core` a monorepo containing (currently) the `ardite` and `ardite-driver-tests` crates? `ardite-rest` and `ardite-graphql` would continue to be there own repositories.

issue.title: Refactor/no key or pointer
issue.body: This was a big enough change that I wanted to make for #43 I wanted it in its own branch. It is ready to be reviewed/merged. It does disable some tests which were failing in #43.

issue.title: Numbers in Value
issue.body:
A large design decision is how should we handle numbers in our `Value` enum? This issue is to list options and collect opinions on the best method.
## Prior Work
- [JSON specification.](http://ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf)
- [Why does `serde_json` use 3 types of number?](https://github.com/serde-rs/json/issues/48)
- [`serde_json`'s JSON type.](https://serde-rs.github.io/json/serde_json/value/enum.Value.html)
- [`rustc-serialize's` JSON type.](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rustc-serialize/rustc_serialize/json/index.html)
## Options
- [Option 1: Single type](#issuecomment-198755355)
- [Option 2: Exact types](#issuecomment-198755432)
- [Option 3: Abstracted types](#issuecomment-198755518)
- [Option 4: Another enum](#issuecomment-204611783)

issue.title: Change Ardite schema into Ardite type system
issue.body:
This is an idea I had. The Ardite schemas was initially inspired by JSON schema, but what we are _really_ doing is letting the user define a type system, not a data schema.

Maybe we should rethink our terminology and approach to schema? I'm thinking most of the code stays the same, but maybe things get renamed.

issue.title: Feat: driver config
issue.body: Adds a driver configuration along with some other refactors. The `de.rs` module is now a lot nicer, and there is also another large comprehensive unit test for `de.rs`.
